private_information: You are one of two robot manipulators operating in a standard Blocks World.
You are responsible for verifying and reporting the legality and effects of a subset of the executed actions.
You can observe and report the changes to the stacks after your assigned actions.
manipulator_1.goal: Verify the actions assigned to you and produce a compact final listing of block relations that you observed after executing them.

private_information: You are the second robot manipulator in the same Blocks World.
You are responsible for verifying and reporting the legality and effects of the complementary subset of executed actions.
You can observe and report the changes to the stacks after your assigned actions.
manipulator_2.goal: Verify the actions assigned to you and produce a compact final listing of block relations that you observed after executing them.

private_information: You coordinate the two manipulators and must integrate their observation reports.
You will produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem instance suitable for the FastDownward solver that captures the final block arrangement.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents reports and emit a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that represent the final configuration of blocks.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World with the usual constraints: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks present are A B C D E F G H I J K.
Initial configuration: A is on the table, C is on top of A, I is on top of C.
Initial configuration: K is on the table, D is on top of K, B is on top of D.
Initial configuration: H is on the table, E is on top of H.
Initial configuration: G is on the table, J is on top of G.
Initial configuration: F is on the table.

report.system_prompt: You are a Blocks World manipulator. You are assigned a subset of actions from a sequence of moves. Your task is to check each assigned action for legality under Blocks World rules and to produce a concise, unambiguous summary of the resulting on relations after performing your actions. Do not emit PDDL. Report which blocks are on the table and which block is directly on which other block at the end of your actions.
report.prompt: You are manipulator_1. Use the public information about the Blocks World and the initial configuration. You are assigned the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth and so on odd-numbered actions up to action 49. Verify each of your assigned actions for legality under the Blocks World rules. Produce a compact final listing of relations in the form block on block or block on table that reflect the state after your assigned actions. If an action appears illegal given the information you have, flag it but do not assume unseen changes. Keep the response concise and factual.

report.system_prompt: You are a Blocks World manipulator. You are assigned the complementary subset of actions from the sequence. Your task is to check each assigned action for legality under Blocks World rules and to produce a concise, unambiguous summary of the resulting on relations after performing your actions. Do not emit PDDL. Report which blocks are on the table and which block is directly on which other block at the end of your actions.
report.prompt: You are manipulator_2. Use the public information about the Blocks World and the initial configuration. You are assigned the even-numbered actions from the sequence where applicable. Verify each of your assigned actions for legality under the Blocks World rules. Produce a compact final listing of relations in the form block on block or block on table that reflect the state after your assigned actions. If an action appears illegal given the information you have, flag it but do not assume unseen changes. Keep the response concise and factual.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an orchestrator expert on multi-agent Blocks World scenarios. You will integrate the observation outputs coming from the two manipulators and produce a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. You must keep the actions and observation provenance distinct where relevant. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should use standard predicates such as on block block, ontable block, clear block, holding block, handempty, and should be compatible with FastDownward conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information and the observation reports from both manipulators. Integrate their verified effects and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the final arrangement of all blocks as the goal. The domain should model the Blocks World operators pick up, put down, stack, and unstack with accurate preconditions and effects. The problem should declare all objects A B C D E F G H I J K and an initial state that matches the final arrangement derived from the executed action sequence. Target the PDDL for compatibility with the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
